Text.Value: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: PC reacting to tadpole in his head
EditorData.SFXTags: tadpole in the head squirm sound

Text.Value: Attack the goblins.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player picks up a rock and chucks it at the bear. The bear roars in anger.

Text.Value: *Roar!*

EditorData.NodeContext: SFX only - Halsin in bear form - do not voice record

Text.Value: He's helpless. Let him go.
Attack the bear.
*The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*
Leave him alone!
Look, look, you'll see. Gimme that rock. I'll show ya!

EditorData.NodeContext: the child is excited., he makes a sweep towards the ground picking up a stone in there hand. this will happen out of shot.

Text.Value: Release the bear immediately or face my wrath!
But - but I wanna hear it squeal!

EditorData.NodeContext: Put off and whiny - someone just told her to stop torturing the woman, and she doesn't like it.

Text.Value: You dare disobey a drow?
Throw a rock at the bear.
Sharper stones might cut through all that fur.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
~The bear must lunges forward, to breaking down the gate
~The gate slams crushes mother goblin

Text.Value: Go on, then. Aim for his eye.
Hmph.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its face
EditorData.NodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

Text.Value: Let him out. I'll take care of the beast.
We made it squeal!

EditorData.NodeContext: Very excited. Not scared at all.

Text.Value: Turn away.
Keep yer hand steady, Three.

EditorData.NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

Text.Value: How dare ya.

EditorData.NodeContext: We're threathening her and she's having none of it.

Text.Value: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
Then I'll just have to kill you.
What the hells are you doing?
All right, all right, if you're gonna throw a tantrum about it. Never seen someone so worked up over a stupid animal.
*Growl.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks at our backs as we turn away, as if begging us to help it.

Text.Value: Leave the bear to the goblin's mercy.
We'll be the ones squealing if we piss off the bear-hugger.
Boss's thinkin' of servin' it to the worgs.

EditorData.NodeContext: fyi, the worg cage is to the left of the cage that holds the bear. if the player is infront of the goblin mother, she might wave her right hand in that genirall direction.

Text.Value: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: PC reacting to tadpole in his head
EditorData.SFXTags: tadpole in the head squirm sound

Text.Value: Boss's thinkin' of servin' it to the worgs. But first, Three, more stones. Make it nice an' bloody.

EditorData.NodeContext: first node surprised that you would stop her, as she thinks you're on her side. second node more annoyed.  She assumes that by explaining, you'll understand why they are hurting this woman.

Text.Value: You will free the beast for me.
Time for blood.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with animals line

Text.Value: You chose. You die with them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with Animals line

Text.Value: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*
Leave.
Oh, y-you're also - Y-yes, of course.

EditorData.NodeContext: She just realised you are way higher in rank and she was talking down to you.

Text.Value: You will free the beast for me.
What're ya - get lost if you can't stand a bit of rough-housin'.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed. We interrupted their 'play'/torture.

Text.Value: How about a taste of your own medicine?
No. Free me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks at our backs as we turn away, as if begging us to help it.
EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with animals line

Text.Value: Hope you can control the furry bastard.
I - I mean no disrespect, just - these are the boss' orders. I can't let it out for no one but a True Soul.
*Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: PC reacting to tadpole in his head
EditorData.SFXTags: tadpole in the head squirm sound

Text.Value: *Whimper.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bear whimpers as the stone hits him and looks at us directly, as if begging us to help it.

Text.Value: You chose. You die with them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with Animals line

Text.Value: Hit it again!

EditorData.NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

Text.Value: Go on, then. Keep at it.
Fine. Do what you want with him.
It's stayin' right 'ere. The beast came in here with those robbers. Killed Dink - and Mince, too.
*A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: PC reacting to tadpole in his head
EditorData.SFXTags: tadpole in the head squirm sound

Text.Value: Side with the freed bear - attack the goblin jailers.
*Growl.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

Text.Value: *Growl.*

EditorData.NodeContext: SFX only - Halsin in bear form. Do not voice record.

Text.Value: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... It's taking something you'll never get back.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: PC reacting to tadpole in his head
EditorData.SFXTags: tadpole in the head squirm sound

Text.Value: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

EditorData.NodeContext: Very excited.

Text.Value: Get rid of them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with Animals line

Text.Value: *Roar!*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bear rears up on it's hind legs (if possible, otherwise starts taking up more space) and roars in anger.

Text.Value: Yeah! Hit its head! I wanna hear more noises!

EditorData.NodeContext: Very excited and curious.

Text.Value: No. Why?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bear whimpers as the stone hits him and looks at us directly, as if begging us to help it.
EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with animals line

Text.Value: Stop them. Free me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

Text.Value: Throw a rock at the bear.
We're juicing it up. The beast came in here with those robbers. Killed Dink - and Mince, too.

EditorData.NodeContext: first node surprised that you would stop her, as she thinks you're on her side. second node more annoyed.  She assumes that by explaining, you'll understand why they are hurting this woman.

Text.Value: Let him out. I'll take care of the beast.
That's it. I'm putting a stop to this.
Time for blood.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bear rears up on it's hind legs (if possible, otherwise starts taking up more space) and roars in anger.
EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with animals line

Text.Value: See?! It squealed!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captive
EditorData.NodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

Text.Value: Oh, you're - uh, y-yes, of course.

EditorData.NodeContext: She just realised you are way higher in rank and she was talking down to you.

Text.Value: And it makes funny noises.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's excited and curious.

Text.Value: Ha!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its face
EditorData.NodeContext: Triumphant hump of excertion

Text.Value: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: PC reacting to tadpole in his head
EditorData.SFXTags: tadpole in the head squirm sound

Text.Value: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'soon'.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: PC reacting to tadpole in his head
EditorData.SFXTags: tadpole in the head squirm sound

Text.Value: One! That's a True Soul you're talkin' to. Show some respect!

EditorData.NodeContext: Stern.

Text.Value: S-sorry, ma'am. I'll open the cage for ya.
S-sorry, sir. I'll open the cage for ya.
S-sorry, True Soul. I'll open the cage for ya.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's talking to someone of much higher rank, and things didn't go smoothly. She's afraid of what you will do if she displeases you.

Text.Value: Release me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with Animals line

Text.Value: Stop it!
I'm putting an end to this. Now.

Synopsis: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
